5268.verse: فَلَمَّا|But when|82|103|141$رَأَوْهُ|they (will) see it|129|171|15715$زُلْفَةً|approaching,|105|147|17141$سِيٓــَٔتْ|(will be) distressed|145|187|17142$وُجُوهُ|(the) faces|95|116|17143$ٱلَّذِينَ|(of) those who|119|127|20$كَفَرُواْ|disbelieved,|97|113|59$وَقِيلَ|and it will be said,|140|156|3478$هَـٰذَا|`This|59|75|248$ٱلَّذِى|(is) that which|118|134|138$كُنتُم|you used (to)|111|119|214$بِهِۦ|for it|52|320|204$تَدَّعُونَ|call.`|87|355|15297$

5269.verse: قُلْ|Say,|50|60|765$أَرَءَيْتُمْ|`Have you seen,|131|151|5597$إِنْ|if|44|64|225$أَهْلَكَنِىَ ٱللَّهُ|Allah destroys me|137|157|17144$وَمَن|and whoever|105|125|1012$مَّعِىَ|(is) with me|99|119|6658$أَوْ|or|41|51|154$رَحِمَنَا|have mercy upon us,|159|168|17145$فَمَن|then who|82|101|402$يُجِيرُ|(can) protect|110|129|12358$ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ|the disbelievers|123|142|364$مِنْ|from|50|69|53$عَذَابٍ|a punishment|108|117|7871$أَلِيمٍ|painful.`|76|76|2718$

5274.verse: وَإِنَّ|And indeed,|98|137|713$لَكَ|for you|67|146|323$لَأَجْرًا|surely (is) a reward|149|228|6678$غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ|endless.|135|174|17152$

5276.verse: فَسَتُبْصِرُ|So soon you will see|155|352|17154$وَيُبْصِرُونَ|and they will see,|137|334|17155$

5277.verse: بِأَييِّكُمُ|Which of you|107|315|17156$ٱلْمَفْتُونُ|(is) the afflicted one.|162|370|17157$

5285.verse: أَن|Because|75|120|655$كَانَ|(he) is|63|152|913$ذَا مَالٍ|a possessor of wealth|165|254|17166$وَبَنِينَ|and children,|105|150|10232$

5286.verse: إِذَا|When|57|82|1370$تُتْلَىٰ|are recited|92|141|3123$عَلَيْهِ|to him|64|113|395$ءَايَـٰتُنَا|Our Verses,|97|146|7237$قَالَ|he says,|76|125|309$أَسَـٰطِيرُ|`Stories|94|118|5506$ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ|(of) the former (people).`|192|192|5507$

5268.verse: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."

5269.verse: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered: whether Allah should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

5270.verse: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."

5271.verse: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"

5272.verse: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,

5273.verse: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.

5274.verse: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.

5275.verse: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.

5276.verse: So you will see and they will see

5277.verse: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

5278.verse: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

5279.verse: Then do not obey the deniers.

5280.verse: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].

5281.verse: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer

5282.verse: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -

5283.verse: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,

5284.verse: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.

5285.verse: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

5286.verse: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
